trans-unit.source: To verify that the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server is currently running, use the <codeph>ping</codeph> command.

seg-source.mrk: To verify that the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server is currently running, use the <codeph>ping</codeph> command.

target.mrk: To verify that the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server is currently running, use the <codeph>ping</codeph> command.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <codeph>ping</codeph> command in the following ways:

seg-source.mrk: You can use the <codeph>ping</codeph> command in the following ways:

target.mrk: You can use the <codeph>ping</codeph> command in the following ways:

trans-unit.source: You can use the script <codeph>NetworkServerControl.bat</codeph> for Windows systems or <codeph>NetworkServerControl.ksh</codeph> for UNIX systems with the <codeph>ping</codeph> command. For example:

seg-source.mrk: You can use the script <codeph>NetworkServerControl.bat</codeph> for Windows systems or <codeph>NetworkServerControl.ksh</codeph> for UNIX systems with the <codeph>ping</codeph> command.

target.mrk: You can use the script <codeph>NetworkServerControl.bat</codeph> for Windows systems or <codeph>NetworkServerControl.ksh</codeph> for UNIX systems with the <codeph>ping</codeph> command.

trans-unit.source: You can use the NetworkServerControl <codeph>ping</codeph> command:

seg-source.mrk: You can use the NetworkServerControl <codeph>ping</codeph> command:

target.mrk: You can use the NetworkServerControl <codeph>ping</codeph> command:

trans-unit.source: You can use the NetworkServerControl API to verify startup from within a Java application:

seg-source.mrk: You can use the NetworkServerControl API to verify startup from within a Java application:

target.mrk: You can use the NetworkServerControl API to verify startup from within a Java application:

trans-unit.source: The following example uses a method to verify startup. It will try to verify for the specified number of seconds:

seg-source.mrk: The following example uses a method to verify startup.
It will try to verify for the specified number of seconds:

target.mrk: The following example uses a method to verify startup.
It will try to verify for the specified number of seconds:

trans-unit.source: private static boolean isServerStarted(NetworkServerControl server, int ntries) { for (int i = 1; i <= ntries; i ++) { try { Thread.sleep(500); server.ping(); return true; } catch (Exception e) { if (i == ntries) { return false; } } } return false; }

seg-source.mrk: private static boolean isServerStarted(NetworkServerControl server, int ntries) { for (int i = 1; i <= ntries; i ++) { try { Thread.sleep(500); server.ping(); return true; } catch (Exception e) { if (i == ntries) { return false; } } } return false; }

target.mrk: private static boolean isServerStarted(NetworkServerControl server, int ntries) { for (int i = 1; i <= ntries; i ++) { try { Thread.sleep(500); server.ping(); return true; } catch (Exception e) { if (i == ntries) { return false; } } } return false; }
